questions.question_text: Your company is using Google Workspace Enterprise Standard. They have 200 meeting rooms defined for the main building and used daily by the 12,000 employees. Users are complaining they have difficulties finding a room available when searching within Google Calendar, even if several rooms are available (no one attending meetings in these rooms at that time). You have been asked to find a solution while minimizing the operational effort and avoiding any new expenses due to budget constraints. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Set the option "Allow calendar-based room release" for all targeted rooms.

The correct option in this scenario is C. By enabling the "Allow calendar-based room release" option for the meeting rooms in Google Calendar, rooms that are reserved but not actually used (all attendees decline) can be automatically released for others to book. This can help optimize the utilization of meeting rooms without the need for additional third-party solutions, scripting, or upgrades.

Enabling this option ensures that rooms are automatically released when they are booked but not attended, improving the availability of meeting rooms for employees. This feature is designed to streamline the process and minimize operational effort.

Selected Answer: C
C. Set the option "Allow calendar-based room release" for all targeted rooms.

Even a brainless person will not mark A as Correct Answer. Who is that? Implementing a Third-party solution will not have any expense? Will it come as gift to you. Useless time waster by giving misleading answer. It is truly a garbage dumping yard. Correct the way you project the answer rather than wasting everyone's time.

Selected Answer: C
https://support.google.com/a/answer/9047638?hl=en

Selected Answer: C

Selected Answer: C

Selected Answer: C

Selected Answer: C
> avoiding any new expenses due to budget constraints

ans is C

choices.B: Create a Google App Script that will inspect each room calendar for the next 12 hours, check attendees status, and send the room administrator an alert email for releasing the room if all attendees have declined but the room has not.
choices.A: Implement a third-party solution that will detect presence in the room and release it if nobody appears after a few minutes.
choices.D: Upgrade to Google Workspace Enterprise Plus edition to benefit from additional features for automated machine learning (ML) based resources management.
choices.C: Set the option "Allow calendar-based room release" for all targeted rooms.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Domain alias because the secondary domain needs update the information of preexisting users (Â¡without updating the information of preexisting users!)

Selected Answer: B
The answer here is B. A would leave you open to conflicting email addresses.

Selected Answer: B
Secondary domain:
- if you plan to replace your primary domain with this new domain. 
- if you want to add a new domain for a separate team or business unit.
User alias domain:
- if you want to add email aliases (alternate email addresses) for your existing users.

Add a user alias domain or secondary domain -> https://support.google.com/a/answer/7502379?hl=en

Selected Answer: A
A. Add the acquired domain as an alias to the primary Google Workspace domain.

The best way to achieve this without updating the information of preexisting users is to add the acquired domain as an alias to the primary Google Workspace domain. This allows users with the new domain to receive emails sent to their previous domain without affecting the email addresses or information of existing users. Users can have multiple email aliases associated with their accounts, and this approach allows for seamless communication between users with different domains within the same Google Workspace environment.

Selected Answer: B
B. Add the acquired domain as a secondary domain to the primary Google Workspace domain, and then update the email information of all new users with alias emails.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
For all the A answers : with an alias, all existing adresses get an alias on the alias domain ("without updating the information of preexisting users"). We need it only for the acquired users but most importantly we are not sure that usernames on the former domain are identical to the ones on the new domain. Secondary domain allow to add aliases for a subset of users and define them accordingly.

Selected Answer: A
A. Add the acquired domain as an alias to the primary Google Workspace domain.

By adding the acquired domain as an alias to the primary Google Workspace domain, you can ensure that the new users with the acquired domain as their primary email address will still be able to receive emails sent to their previous domain. This allows for seamless communication between users of both domains without the need to update the email information of preexisting users or make any significant changes to the domain configuration. This approach is the most efficient and straightforward way to achieve the desired result.

questions.question_text: Your company has just acquired a new group of users. They have been provisioned into the Google Workspace environment with your primary domain as their primary email address. These new users still need to receive emails from their previous domain. What is the best way to achieve this for these new users, without updating the information of preexisting users?

choices.D: Without adding a domain, update each user's email information with the previous domain.
choices.C: Update the Google-provided test domain to be the domain of the acquired company, and then update the email information of all new users with alias emails.
choices.B: Add the acquired domain as a secondary domain to the primary Google Workspace domain, and then update the email information of all new users with alias emails.
choices.A: Add the acquired domain as an alias to the primary Google Workspace domain.

questions.question_text: The application development team requests that a new, internal, domain-owned Google Workspace app be allowed to access Google Drive APIs. You are currently restricting access to all APIs using an approved allowlist, per security policy. You need to grant access for this app. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Add OAuth Client ID to the Google Drive Trusted List.

To grant access for the new, internal, domain-owned Google Workspace app to access Google Drive APIs while maintaining the security policy, you should add the OAuth Client ID of the app to the Google Drive Trusted List. This approach allows you to specifically authorize the identified app without enabling access to all APIs or making broad changes to the security configuration.

Option C provides a targeted and controlled solution to enable access for the specific app that needs to interact with Google Drive APIs.

Selected Answer: C
C. Add OAuth Client ID to the Google Drive Trusted List.
Same illogical contradictory answers. Correct Answer A. What do you understand what that means? How you put this as correct answer? Useless & full of garbage. Stop this nonsense.

Selected Answer: C
C. Add OAuth Client ID to the Google Drive Trusted List.

By adding the OAuth Client ID of the internal, domain-owned Google Workspace app to the Google Drive Trusted List, you can grant specific access to the Google Drive APIs while still maintaining the security policy of restricting access to approved allowlisted apps. This approach ensures that only the designated app has access to the Google Drive APIs without opening up access for all apps or altering your security configuration extensively.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.
To grant access for the new internal, domain-owned Google Workspace app to access Google Drive APIs while still adhering to the security policy of restricting access using an approved allowlist, you should add the OAuth Client ID of the app to the Google Drive Trusted List.

Selected Answer: C
C to add new Oauth client

choices.A: Enable all API access for Google Drive.
choices.C: Add OAuth Client ID to the Google Drive Trusted List.
choices.B: Enable the "trust domain owned apps" setting.
choices.D: Allowlist the app in the Google Workspace Marketplace.

questions.question_text: An administrator accidentally deleted several Workspace user accounts from the Google Admin Console two weeks ago. How can you recover the deleted user accounts?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Sign in to the Admin console as Super Admin, open user management, filter for "recently deleted," and recover.

comments.content:
You can restore a user account (including administrator accounts) up to 20 days after deleting it. After 20 days, the data is gone and you canât restore it. 

If the user was previously suspended or had their data transferred, they'll show as a suspended user. To give them access to their data, go to Restore a suspended user.

Note: Learn how to delete a user from your organization.

questions.question_text: You need to protect your users from untrusted senders sending encrypted attachments via email. You must ensure that these messages are not delivered to users' mailboxes. What step should be taken?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. A quarentine

Selected Answer: D
D. Enable a safety rule to send these types of messages to a quarantine.
